predictions.text: At least one top-10 global container shipping carrier (by capacity) will publicly announce a temporary suspension/avoidance of Strait of Hormuz transits (or Persian Gulf port calls) lasting at least 72 consecutive hours due to security risk.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if a top-10 carrier (e.g., MSC, Maersk, CMA CGM, COSCO, Hapag-Lloyd, ONE, Evergreen) issues a press release, customer advisory, or official website notice stating it is suspending/avoiding Hormuz transits or Gulf calls for >=72 hours for security reasons by the deadline.
evidence: Reports of Iran partially restricting the Strait of Hormuz raise immediate commercial-shipping disruption risk (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/iran-us-strait-of-hormuz-oil-nuclear-talks-geneva.html
monitoring_signals: Carrier customer advisories (Maersk, MSC, CMA CGM, Hapag-Lloyd, ONE)
Lloyd’s List / TradeWinds reporting on route suspensions
UKMTO advisories and incident reports
Joint War Committee (JWC) Listed Areas updates
Freightos/SCFI spot-rate spikes on Middle East routes
predictions.rationale: Partial restrictions and heightened Gulf security risk often trigger short, explicit carrier advisories to limit liability and protect crews/insurance coverage.

predictions.text: The U.S. will announce an emergency release (sale or exchange) from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve totaling at least 20 million barrels in a single authorization.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if DOE announces an SPR emergency release (sale/exchange) with a stated volume >=20 million barrels in one authorization (not cumulative across multiple small actions) by the deadline.
evidence: Strait of Hormuz restrictions elevate oil-supply risk and increase likelihood of U.S. market-stabilization actions (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/iran-us-strait-of-hormuz-oil-nuclear-talks-geneva.html
monitoring_signals: DOE SPR press releases and Notices of Sale/Exchange
White House statements on fuel prices/supply disruptions
EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report commentary
Brent/WTI backwardation widening and Gulf tanker rates
predictions.rationale: If Gulf disruptions persist or prices jump sharply, an SPR action is a common short-horizon policy tool.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce a sanctions action (press release) adding at least 5 persons/entities tied to Iran-linked maritime security threats (e.g., IRGC-affiliated shipping, logistics, or front companies) explicitly referencing threats/disruptions to maritime traffic in the Gulf/Strait of Hormuz.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if a U.S. Treasury/OFAC press release announces Iran-related designations adding >=5 persons/entities and explicitly mentions maritime traffic disruption/attacks or the Strait of Hormuz/Gulf shipping as justification by the deadline.
evidence: Escalation around Hormuz increases odds of U.S. coercive measures targeting facilitators (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/iran-us-strait-of-hormuz-oil-nuclear-talks-geneva.html
monitoring_signals: Treasury/OFAC press releases and SDN list updates
State Department Iran/maritime security statements
UKMTO/CMF incident reporting that triggers U.S. responses
Shipping intelligence reports on IRGC-linked networks
predictions.rationale: Maritime-related incidents often prompt rapid, targeted designation packages aimed at logistics/finance enablers.

predictions.text: Meta Platforms will raise its FY2026 capital expenditure (capex) outlook to a midpoint of at least $60 billion in an earnings release or earnings-call prepared remarks.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Meta’s FY2026 capex guidance range is updated such that the midpoint is >=$60B, stated in an earnings release, 10-Q, or prepared remarks by the deadline.
evidence: Meta is expanding Nvidia partnership and planning very large chip deployments, implying upward pressure on capex (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/meta-nvidia-deal-ai-data-center-chips.html
monitoring_signals: Meta quarterly earnings releases and 10-Qs
Management commentary on data-center buildout timelines
Nvidia supply allocation disclosures and lead-time chatter
Data-center power procurement and construction announcements
predictions.rationale: Scaling to ‘millions of chips’ typically forces capex guide raises as power, networking, and build schedules firm up.

predictions.text: Berkshire Hathaway will report cash, cash equivalents, and U.S. Treasury bills of at least $250 billion at a quarter-end (reported in a 10-Q/10-K or earnings release).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Berkshire’s reported ‘cash and cash equivalents’ plus ‘U.S. Treasury bills’ (or equivalent line items) at a quarter-end total >=$250B in a filing/release published by the deadline.
evidence: Recent reporting highlights Berkshire de-risking/portfolio shifts, consistent with elevated liquidity preference (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/berkshire-hathaway-trims-apple-stake-buys-nytimes-stock-in-buffetts-last-moves-as-ceo.html
monitoring_signals: Berkshire 10-Q/10-K balance sheet line items
Berkshire earnings releases and shareholder letter updates
13F changes indicating net selling vs buying
Treasury-bill issuance/auction conditions (liquidity parking)
predictions.rationale: If equity risk stays elevated, Berkshire’s tendency to accumulate bills/cash can push totals above prior highs.

predictions.text: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) will close at least 20% below its 2026-02-17 close on at least one trading day.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if PANW daily closing price is <= (0.80 × PANW close on 2026-02-17) on any trading day by the deadline (per Nasdaq/NYSE official close data).
evidence: PANW sold off on underwhelming outlook, signaling valuation sensitivity and downside volatility risk (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/palo-alto-networks-panw-q2-2026-earnings.html
monitoring_signals: PANW price/volume and options-implied volatility
Cybersecurity peer guidance (CRWD, FTNT, ZS)
Enterprise IT spending surveys and CIO budget trackers
Rate moves impacting high-multiple software valuations
predictions.rationale: Post-guidance-reset periods often see follow-on downgrades and multiple compression, producing additional downside tails.

predictions.text: Amazon.com will complete at least $10 billion in aggregate gross bond issuance (USD) across one or more offerings.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Amazon issues bonds totaling >=$10B gross proceeds (sum across offerings) by the deadline, confirmed via SEC filings, company press release, or major underwriting bank deal terms reported by Bloomberg/Reuters.
evidence: Large-cap volatility and investment cycles increase incentives to term out funding when windows open (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/amazon-stock-losing-streak.html
monitoring_signals: Amazon treasury/IR updates and SEC filings
Bloomberg/Reuters new-issue calendars
Investment-grade spread levels and issuance windows
Peer mega-cap issuance (Apple/Microsoft/Alphabet comparisons)
predictions.rationale: Even with strong cash generation, opportunistic jumbo issuance is common for mega-caps amid capex and refinancing flexibility needs.

predictions.text: The U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB) will publish a new or updated memorandum directing federal agencies to accelerate post-quantum cryptography (PQC) migration planning (inventorying cryptographic systems and setting deadlines), explicitly referencing NIST PQC standards.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if OMB posts an official memo by the deadline that (a) references NIST PQC standards and (b) requires agencies to complete at least one concrete PQC migration action (e.g., inventory, plan submission, procurement requirement) with a specified timeline.
evidence: Growing attention to quantum advances and encryption vulnerabilities supports policy action for PQC transition (ScienceDaily, 2026-02-16): https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2026/02/260216084525.htm
monitoring_signals: OMB memorandum releases (whitehouse.gov/omb)
NIST NCCoE and PQC program updates
CISA cryptographic guidance and transition playbooks
Federal procurement language referencing PQC requirements
predictions.rationale: As quantum milestones and risk narratives rise, OMB often formalizes migration steps to reduce long-tail federal cyber exposure.

predictions.text: Japan (government and/or a Japan-led consortium of companies) will publicly announce new, incremental U.S. investment commitments totaling at least $30 billion (USD equivalent), explicitly framed as part of bilateral economic cooperation with the U.S. administration.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if a joint statement/press conference/official release from Japanese government ministries or named major Japanese firms states incremental U.S.-bound investment commitments summing to >=$30B (USD equivalent), with the bilateral framing explicit, by the deadline.
evidence: Reporting indicates early Japanese commitments to invest in the U.S., suggesting follow-on announcements are plausible (NYT, 2026-02-17): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/17/business/japan-trump-investments.html
monitoring_signals: Japan PM/METI announcements and MOUs
U.S. Commerce/White House investment event readouts
Corporate capex press releases (auto, semiconductor, battery, pharma)
FDI pipeline reporting from Nikkei/Reuters/Bloomberg
predictions.rationale: Industrial-policy competition and trade diplomacy often produce large, headlineable FDI packages over subsequent quarters.

predictions.text: A U.S. federal court will issue at least one publicly docketed temporary restraining order (TRO) or preliminary injunction related to DHS funding/shutdown impacts (e.g., employee pay, program operations, or contracting), explicitly citing a DHS appropriations lapse or imminent lapse as the precipitating event.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if PACER or court press reporting shows a TRO/preliminary injunction order in a case where the triggering basis is a DHS funding lapse or imminent lapse, and the order text explicitly references that lapse, by the deadline.
evidence: DHS funding impasse increases operational disruption risk and legal challenges tied to shutdown mechanics (CNBC, 2026-02-17): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/17/dhs-shutdown-democrats-trump-counteroffer-funding-homeland.html
monitoring_signals: PACER searches for DHS shutdown-related filings
Federal employee union litigation announcements (AFGE, NTEU)
GAO and OMB shutdown guidance updates
Major airport/transport security disruption reports
predictions.rationale: Shutdown brinkmanship can trigger rapid litigation over pay, contractor obligations, and statutory duties, though thresholds for injunctive relief are high.
